GUI

Class StoreTests

  • java.lang.Object
    • GUI.StoreTests

  • public class StoreTests
extends java.lang.Object
    Tests the class Store.java
    Author:
    Alex Koppon

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StoreTests() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void AddAndRemoveCapital()
      Check that the store returns the correct capital after both adding and removing capital from the store
      void checkCaptial()
      Check that the store returns the correct capital
      void checkEmptyStock()
      check that the stock is initially empty
      void checknewCapital()
      Check that adding capital changes the store's capital by the correct amount
      void checknewCapitalString()
      Check that the String of the capital returns correctly after some capital is added
      void CheckNonEmptyStock()
      Check that the store's stock matches the items and quantities of the stock added to it
      void checkStoreName()
      Check that the store returns the correct name
      void setUpStore()
      Before each test set up the store with its name, $0.00 in capital and an empty Stock As this is a singleton class, this 'reset' helps test the class, as changes otherwise persist through tests
      void testCapitalManifest()
      Check that importing a manifest correctly updates the store's capital
      void testImportInventory()
      Check that the stock is correct after loading in a manifest
      void testLoadSalesCost()
      Check that loading in sales correctly increases the capital of the store
      void testLoadSalesStock()
      Check that the correct amount of stock is in the store after loading in sales
      void testNameChange()
      Check that the name is changed after setting a new name
      void testStockManifest()
      Check that generating a manifest produces the correct stock String
